definition: to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: All cottages are enclosed by green trees.
sentences.chinese: 所有的村舍都被绿树所包围。

sentences.english: The country lane twists and turns between small cottages.
sentences.chinese: 乡间的小路在村舍之间蜿蜒盘绕。

sentences.english: He is incommunicado in a secluded cottage in Wales.
sentences.chinese: 他隐居在威尔士一个偏僻的小村舍里。

sentences.english: We were snow-bound in the cottage for two weeks .
sentences.chinese: 我们让大雪困在村舍里两个星期。

sentences.english: The village houses are speckled on the grassland.
sentences.chinese: 绿色的草原上点缀着几间村舍。

sentences.english: A lamp burns in the distant cottage under banana trees.
sentences.chinese: 远处村舍的香蕉树下，一盏灯正在燃烧。

sentences.english: It’s a beautiful cottage not more than five minutes from the nearest beach.
sentences.chinese: 那是一幢漂亮的村舍，离最近的海滩仅5分钟的路程。

sentences.english: Content lodges oftener in cottages than palaces.
sentences.chinese: 满意常在村舍，而不在王宫。

sentences.english: To bend with apples the moss'd cottage-trees.
sentences.chinese: 村舍前爬满青苔的老树，被苹果压弯了枝桠。

sentences.english: Ivy ran over the walls of the cottage.
sentences.chinese: 村舍的墙壁上爬满了常春藤。

sentences.english: These village cottages take in paying guests during the summer holidays.
sentences.chinese: 暑假期间这些农家村舍接待付费的旅客。

sentences.english: Small gritstone -built houses and cottages of a somewhat sordid aspect stood on either side of the street.
sentences.chinese: 街道两边是外表有些肮脏的粗砾石建成的小屋和村舍。

sentences.english: The film star eventually went to earth in a small, out-of-the-way cottage.
sentences.chinese: 这位电影明星最后跑到一个荒避的小村舍躲了起来。

definition: hidden from view/alternately hidden and visible/setting off each other
brick house with a tiled roof
